ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Did the examiner explain the following to the participant and their parents/guardians: purpose of the 2-channel QEEG screening session
Did the examiner explain the following to the participant and their parents/guardians: association between the various frequency bands and symptoms of inattention/hyperactivity/impulsivity
Did the examiner explain the following to the participant and their parents/guardians: results of the assessment
Did the examiner obtain sufficient, valid 2-channel QEEG screening       data during eyes open baseline to enable computation of the       theta/beta ratio (TBR) at Cz; Fz?
If so, did the software correctly calculate the Theta-Beta Ratio?
Did the examiner obtain 2-channel QEEG screening data during reading, listening, and drawing tasks?
Did the software correctly calculate the overall Theta-Beta Ratio?
Were the results of the assessment recorded accurately?
Did the examiner correctly classify the Theta-Beta Ratio as "meeting" or "not meeting" criterion?
If participant/parents had any adverse reactions, were they recorded and addressed?
If there were adverse reactions, please list here:
Total number of questions answered yes
Maxmimum sum possible for questions answered
Percent adhereance of assessment (total score divided by max sum possible)
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Site
Session
Validity rating
ID for the Experiment/settings/run
Respondent Source
Notes: 1= subject; 2= parent; 3= clinician; 4= teacher; 5= trainer; 6= fidelity reviewer
